div.p: From Charles Topp to Alexander Peacock
C96/9678, unit 906, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
Memo. for the Honourable the Chief Secy

I have the honor to report that it is desirable that some officer should be made responsible for the care and good order of the large and valuable Herbarium (containing some 750,000 specimens of about 50,000 species of plants) which was under the control of the Government Botanist.

I therefore beg to recommend that Mr Luehmann the senior officer in that branch and a 4th class clerical officer be appointed to act as Curator of the Herbarium. Mr Luehmann is carrying on the work in […] with the branch and is thoroughly competent for the position of Curator
On 16 November 1896 the Chief Secretary, A. Peacock, minuted: 'App[roved] by Cabinet'. MS annotation: 'J G. Luehmann appointed C10331 27.11.96'. A letter was sent to Luehmann on 10 December.
